sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The fathers counsell. Or, Certain usefull directions, for all young persons, especially elder brothers, whose portion it is or may be, in these perilous daies, to be left in a fatherlesse or friendlesse condition. / By W.T. Tipping, William, 1598-1649.
[2], 43, [1] p.
Printed by G.M. for Christopher Meredith at the signe of the Crane in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1644. [i.e. 1643]
W.T. = William Tipping. Thomason received his copy in October 1643. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octo: 14 1643"; the 4 in the imprint date has been crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The fathers counsell. Or, Certain usefull directions, for all young persons, especially elder brothers, whose portion it is or may be, in these perilous daies, to be left in a fatherlesse or friendlesse condition. / By W.T. Tipping, William, 1598-1649.
[2], 43, [1] p.
Printed by G.M. for Christopher Meredith at the signe of the Crane in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1644. [i.e. 1643]
W.T. = William Tipping. Thomason received his copy in October 1643. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octo: 14 1643"; the 4 in the imprint date has been crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Christopher Meredith
G.M.
the signe of the Crane in Pauls Church-yard
